ingredients: 4 slices crusty bread (rye, sourdough or whole grain)
Optional: garlic cloves for rubbing bread
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Crack eggs into pan, being careful not to break yolks
Season with salt and pepper
Cook until whites are set but yolks are still runny, 3-4 minutes
For over-easy, carefully flip and cook 30 more seconds
Toast bread until golden and crispy
Optional: rub warm bread with cut garlic clove
Place eggs on toast, garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while eggs are hot

ingredients: 2 cups Greek yogurt or plain yogurt
instructions: Spoon yogurt into serving bowls
Drizzle honey generously over the yogurt
Add vanilla extract and cinnamon if using, stir gently
Top with fresh berries
Optional: add granola for crunch
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts
Optional: garnish with fresh mint
Serve immediately
For meal prep: layer ingredients in jars, refrigerate for up to 3 days

recipe.title: Chicken teriyaki with rice
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 1.5 cups cottage cheese or farmer's cheese (tvorog)
3-4 tbsp butter or oil for frying
Optional: honey or jam for serving
instructions: Place cottage cheese in a bowl, mash with a fork
Add egg, sugar, salt, and vanilla, mix well
Add 1/4 cup flour, mix until combined
Optional: add raisins or dried cranberries
The dough should be slightly sticky but manageable
Place 1/2 cup flour in a shallow plate for coating
Take about 2 tbsp of dough, form into a small patty
Dredge both sides in flour, shake off excess
Repeat with remaining dough
Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Fry syrniki in batches for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown
Don't crowd the pan - cook 3-4 at a time
Transfer to paper towels to drain excess oil
Serve warm with sour cream, honey, or fresh berries
Can be served for breakfast or dessert

recipe.title: Cottage cheese with herbs
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 1 large onion, very finely chopped or grated
Optional: vinegar or soy sauce for dipping
instructions: Make dough: mix flour and salt, make a well in center
Add egg and water, gradually mix until dough forms
Knead for 5-8 minutes until smooth and elastic
Cover with plastic wrap, rest for 30 minutes
Make filling: mix beef, pork, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper
Mix thoroughly, you can use a food processor for finer texture
Refrigerate filling until ready to use
Roll dough thin on floured surface
Cut into 2-inch circles using a glass or cutter
Place 1 tsp filling in center of each circle
Fold in half to form a half-moon, press edges to seal
Bring corners together, pinch to form traditional pelmeni shape
Place on floured surface until ready to cook
Bring large pot of salted water to boil
Add pelmeni, stir gently so they don't stick
Cook for 7-10 minutes until they float
Remove with slotted spoon
Toss with butter, serve with sour cream and fresh dill
Optional: add vinegar or soy sauce for dipping

ingredients: 1 cup cottage cheese or farmer's cheese (tvorog)
instructions: Make the batter: whisk flour, eggs, milk, melted butter, sugar and salt until smooth
Let batter rest for 20-30 minutes
Make filling: mix cottage cheese, ricotta, egg yolk, sugar, and vanilla until combined
Optional: add raisins to the filling
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat, lightly grease with butter
Pour small ladle of batter, swirling to coat pan thinly
Cook until edges lift and bubbles form, about 45 seconds
Flip and cook 15-20 seconds more until set
Stack blini on a plate, keep warm
To serve, place 2-3 tbsp of cheese filling in center of each blini
Fold into quarters or roll up
Serve warm, topped with sour cream if desired

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, daikon, cucumber, cauliflower)
instructions: Cut vegetables into sticks or bite-sized pieces
In a saucepan, combine vinegar, water, sugar and salt
Bring to a simmer, stirring until sugar dissolves
Let the pickling liquid cool completely
Place vegetables, garlic, ginger, and chilies in clean glass jars
Pour cooled liquid over vegetables to cover completely
Add fresh herbs if desired
Seal jars and refrigerate for at least 24 hours
Vegetables will keep for 2-3 weeks refrigerated
Serve cold as a snack or side dish

ingredients: 2 tbsp tamarind paste or 2 tbsp lime juice + 1 tbsp brown sugar
1 tbsp palm sugar or brown sugar
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes until soft, drain
Mix fish sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar in a small bowl, set aside
Heat wok or large pan over high heat, add 1 tbsp oil
Stir-fry garlic and dried shrimp (if using) for 30 seconds
Add shrimp, cook 2-3 minutes until pink, remove from pan and set aside
Add remaining oil to pan, scramble eggs and set aside
Return to high heat, add drained noodles
Pour sauce over noodles, toss to coat evenly
Cook 2-3 minutes, tossing frequently
Add shrimp and eggs back to wok, toss together
Add bean sprouts and green onions, toss 30 seconds
Remove from heat
Serve topped with crushed peanuts and lime wedges
Optional: add chili flakes for heat

ingredients: 3 cups cooked rice, preferably day-old and cold
Optional: protein of choice (chicken, shrimp, tofu)
instructions: Heat wok or large pan over high heat with 1 tbsp oil
Add beaten eggs, scramble quickly until just set, remove from pan and set aside
Add remaining oil to pan over high heat
Add garlic, stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant
Add carrots, peas, and corn, stir-fry for 2-3 minutes
Add cold rice, breaking up any clumps with spatula
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, pressing rice against pan to get crispy edges
Return eggs to pan, add soy sauce and oyster sauce
Toss everything together for 1-2 minutes until well combined
Remove from heat, add white pepper and sesame oil
Garnish with green onions and cilantro if desired
Serve hot

ingredients: 1 tbsp coarse sea salt or flake salt
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil
Add salt to the water
Add frozen edamame, boil for 4-5 minutes
Edamame should be tender but still slightly firm
Drain well in a colander
Immediately toss with coarse sea salt while still hot
Optional: add soy sauce, chili flakes, sesame seeds, or garlic powder
Transfer to a serving bowl
Serve warm or at room temperature
To eat: squeeze the beans from the pods, discard pods
Do not eat the pods

ingredients: 30g beef tenderloin per bowl, very thinly sliced
instructions: Char onion and ginger over high heat until blackened on cut sides
Toast spices (star anise, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, coriander) in dry pan for 3 minutes
Rinse bones and brisket, cover with water, boil for 5 minutes, then drain and rinse
Bring 3.5 litres water to boil, add bones, brisket, charred onion and ginger, and toasted spices
Simmer covered for 3 hours
Remove brisket (it should be fall-apart tender), cool, then refrigerate for later use
Simmer remaining broth uncovered for 40 more minutes
Strain broth into another pot, discard bones and spices
Add fish sauce, adjust with sugar and salt if needed
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions
Place noodles in bowls, top with raw beef slices and brisket slices
Ladle hot broth over beef (it will cook to medium rare)
Serve with toppings on the side
